article:
Wangaratta Football Club

The Wangaratta Football Club is an Australian rules football club based in Wangaratta, Victoria. The club was founded in 1874 and has a rich history in the Ovens and Murray Football League. The club has won numerous premierships and has produced several notable footballers who have gone on to play in the Victorian Football League (VFL) and Australian Football League (AFL).

# Club History

The Wangaratta Football Club was founded in 1874, making it one of the oldest football clubs in Victoria. The club has a long and storied history, having played in various competitions over the years. In the early days, the club played in the Wangaratta District Football Association, before joining the Ovens and Murray Football League in 1893.

## Early Years

In the early years, the club struggled to find success, often finishing at the bottom of the ladder. However, in 1902, the club won its first premiership, defeating Rutherglen in the grand final. This was the start of a successful period for the club, which went on to win several more premierships in the following years.

## Golden Era

The 1950s and 1960s are often referred to as the "Golden Era" of the Wangaratta Football Club. During this period, the club won five premierships, including three in a row from 1955 to 1957. The club also produced several notable footballers, including Ron Cahir, who went on to play for the Richmond Football Club in the VFL.

## Modern Era

In the modern era, the Wangaratta Football Club has continued to compete at a high level. The club has won several premierships, including two in the 1990s. In 2008, the club celebrated its 125th anniversary, marking a significant milestone in its history.

# Football Competition Timeline

article:
Eiji Tsuburaya

Eiji Tsuburaya (, Tsuburaya Eiji, July 7, 1901 – January 25, 1970) was a Japanese special effects director, filmmaker, and entrepreneur. He is best known for his work on the Godzilla franchise and his contributions to the development of tokusatsu, a genre of Japanese live-action films and television shows that combine science fiction, fantasy, and adventure elements.

# Biography

## Childhood to war years: 1901–1945

### Childhood and youth (1901–1919)

Eiji Tsuburaya was born on July 7, 1901, in Sukagawa, Fukushima Prefecture, Japan. He was the youngest of four children to a family of modest means. Tsuburaya's early life was marked by a strong interest in science fiction and fantasy, which was encouraged by his parents. He attended local schools and developed a passion for photography and filmmaking.

### Early career and marriage (1919–1934)

In 1919, Tsuburaya left school to pursue a career in filmmaking. He began working as a photographer and camera assistant at a local film studio. In 1926, he married Chiyo Tachibana, and the couple had two children. Tsuburaya continued to work in the film industry, eventually becoming a cinematographer and special effects technician.

### J.O. Studios, directorial works, and Toho (1934–1940)

In 1934, Tsuburaya joined J.O. Studios, a Tokyo-based film production company. He worked on several films, including "The Daughter of the Samurai" (1937), which was released in the United States as "The Samurai's Daughter." Tsuburaya's work on this film caught the attention of Toho Studios, which hired him as a special effects director in 1938.

### War years (1941–1945)

During World War II, Tsuburaya worked on several propaganda films and military training videos. He also developed techniques for creating special effects using miniatures and matte paintings. In 1944, Tsuburaya was drafted into the Japanese military and served as a cameraman and special effects technician.

## Occupation years to Chūshingura: 1946–1962

### Early postwar work (1946–1954)

After Japan's surrender in 1945, Tsuburaya returned to Toho Studios and resumed his work as a special effects director. He worked on several films, including "The Invisible Man Appears" (1949) and "The Last War" (1961). Tsuburaya's work during this period was marked by a focus on science fiction and fantasy themes.

### International recognition (1954–1959)

In 1954, Tsuburaya's work on the film "Godzilla" brought him international recognition. The film's success led to the creation of several sequels and spin-offs, including "Mothra" (1961) and "The Last War" (1961). Tsuburaya's work on these films cemented his reputation as a master of special effects.

### From The Secret of the Telegian to Chūshingura (1960–1962)

In 1960, Tsuburaya worked on the film "The Secret of the Telegian," which was released in the United States as "The Telegian." He also worked on "The Last War" (1961) and "Chūshingura" (1962), a film based on a classic Japanese novel.

## Birth of a company to last years: 1963–1970

### Birth of a company and career expansion (1963–1964)

In 1963, Tsuburaya founded Tsuburaya Productions, a company that would go on to produce many of his most famous works. He also began working on television shows, including "Ultra Q" (1966) and "Ultraman" (1966).

### Japanese-American coproductions and Ultra Q (1964–1965)

In 1964, Tsuburaya began working on Japanese-American coproductions, including the film "Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster" (1964). He also worked on "Ultra Q," a science fiction television show that was released in the United States as "Ultra Q: The Complete Series."

### Ultraman and beyond (1966–1967)

In 1966, Tsuburaya worked on "Ultraman," a science fiction television show that was released in the United States as "Ultraman: The Complete Series." He also worked on several other television shows, including "Ultra Seven" (1967) and "Captain Ultra" (1967).

### Final works, last years, and death (1968–1970)

Tsuburaya's final works included the film "Destroy All Monsters" (1968) and the television show "Ultra Fight" (1970). He died on January 25, 1970, at the age of 68.

# Filmmaking

## Style, themes, and techniques

Tsuburaya's filmmaking style was marked by a focus on science fiction and fantasy themes. He was known for his use of miniatures, matte paintings, and other special effects techniques. Tsuburaya's films often featured a mix of action, adventure, and humor.

## Relationship with cast and crew

Tsuburaya was known for his collaborative approach to filmmaking. He worked closely with his cast and crew to develop ideas and bring his vision to life. Tsuburaya was also known for his ability to bring out the best in his actors, many of whom went on to become stars in their own right.

## Production and editing

Tsuburaya was heavily involved in all aspects of production, from script development to editing. He was known for his attention to detail and his ability to bring his vision to life on screen.

# Legacy

## Cultural impact

Tsuburaya's work has had a profound impact on popular culture. His films and television shows have influenced countless other creators, from Hayao Miyazaki to Guillermo del Toro. Tsuburaya's legacy can be seen in everything from science fiction films to anime and manga.

## Tributes

Tsuburaya has been the subject of several tributes and retrospectives over the years. His work has been celebrated at film festivals around the world, and he has been recognized with numerous awards and honors.

## Portrayals

Tsuburaya has been portrayed in several films and television shows, including the 2014 film "Mothra" and the 2016 television show "Ultraman Orb."

# Selected filmography

## Films

* "The Daughter of the Samurai" (1937)
* "Godzilla" (1954)
* "Mothra" (1961)
* "The Last War" (1961)
* "Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster" (1964)

## Television

* "Ultra Q" (1966)

* "Ultra Seven" (1967)
* "Captain Ultra" (1967)

# Awards and honors

Tsuburaya received numerous awards and honors during his career, including the Japanese Academy Award for Best Special Effects.

# Notes

Tsuburaya's work continues to be celebrated and studied by scholars and fans around the world.

article:
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770–1831) was a German philosopher who is widely regarded as one of the most important figures in the history of philosophy. His philosophical system, which emphasized the absolute and the unity of all things, had a profound impact on many areas of thought, including metaphysics, epistemology, politics, and aesthetics. Hegel's ideas continue to influence contemporary debates in philosophy, politics, and culture.

# Life

## Formative years

### Stuttgart, Tübingen, Berne, Frankfurt (1770–1800)

Hegel was born on August 27, 1770, in Stuttgart, Germany. His father, Georg Ludwig Hegel, was a secretary to the Duke of Württemberg, and his mother, Maria Magdalena Fromm, was a homemaker. Hegel's childhood was marked by a strict Lutheran upbringing and a strong emphasis on education. He attended the Stuttgart Gymnasium, where he excelled in his studies, particularly in philosophy and theology.

In 1788, Hegel enrolled in the University of Tübingen, where he studied philosophy, theology, and philology. During his time at Tübingen, Hegel became friends with his roommates, Friedrich Hölderlin and Friedrich Schelling, both of whom would later become prominent figures in the German Romantic movement.

After completing his studies at Tübingen, Hegel worked as a tutor in Berne, Switzerland, and later in Frankfurt, Germany. During this period, he began to develop his philosophical ideas, particularly in the areas of metaphysics and epistemology.

## Career years

### Jena, Bamberg, Nuremberg (1801–1816)

In 1801, Hegel accepted a position as a lecturer at the University of Jena, where he taught philosophy and wrote several influential works, including "The Phenomenology of Spirit" (1807). During his time at Jena, Hegel became associated with the Jena Circle, a group of intellectuals who were influenced by the ideas of Immanuel Kant and the French Revolution.

In 1806, Hegel left Jena and took a position as a rector at the Bamberg Gymnasium. He remained in Bamberg for several years, during which time he wrote "The Science of Logic" (1812–1816).

In 1816, Hegel accepted a position as a professor of philosophy at the University of Heidelberg, where he taught until 1818. During his time at Heidelberg, Hegel wrote "The Encyclopedia of the Philosophical Sciences" (1817).

### Heidelberg, Berlin (1816–1831)

In 1818, Hegel accepted a position as a professor of philosophy at the University of Berlin, where he taught until his death in 1831. During his time at Berlin, Hegel became one of the most prominent figures in German philosophy, and his ideas had a profound impact on many areas of thought.

# Influences

Hegel's philosophical system was influenced by a wide range of thinkers, including Immanuel Kant, Jean-Jacques Rousseau, and Johann Gottlieb Fichte. He was also influenced by the ideas of the French Revolution and the German Romantic movement.

# The Phenomenology of Spirit

"The Phenomenology of Spirit" (1807) is one of Hegel's most famous works. In this book, Hegel explores the nature of consciousness and the development of the human spirit. He argues that consciousness progresses through a series of stages, from sense-certainty to absolute knowledge.

# Philosophical system

## Science of Logic

"The Science of Logic" (1812–1816) is a comprehensive work that outlines Hegel's philosophical system. In this book, Hegel argues that reality is a rational, systematic whole, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

## Philosophy of the real

Hegel's philosophy of the real is concerned with the nature of reality and the relationship between the individual and the world. He argues that reality is a unified, systematic whole, and that the individual is an integral part of this whole.

## The Philosophy of Nature

"The Philosophy of Nature" (1817) is a work that explores the nature of the natural world. In this book, Hegel argues that the natural world is a rational, systematic whole, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

## The Philosophy of Spirit

"The Philosophy of Spirit" (1817) is a work that explores the nature of the human spirit. In this book, Hegel argues that the human spirit is a rational, systematic whole, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

### Subjective spirit

Hegel's concept of subjective spirit refers to the individual's inner world, including their thoughts, feelings, and experiences.

### Objective spirit

Hegel's concept of objective spirit refers to the external world, including social and cultural institutions.

### Absolute spirit

Hegel's concept of absolute spirit refers to the highest level of human consciousness, in which the individual achieves a complete understanding of the world and their place in it.

# Philosophy of art

Hegel's philosophy of art is concerned with the nature of beauty and the role of art in human culture. He argues that art is a way of expressing the absolute, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

# Christianity

Hegel's views on Christianity are complex and multifaceted. He argues that Christianity is a way of expressing the absolute, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

## Early Romantic writings

Hegel's early writings on Christianity were influenced by the ideas of the German Romantic movement. During this period, he argued that Christianity was a way of expressing the absolute, and that it could be understood through the use of dialectics.

## The Phenomenology of Spirit

In "The Phenomenology of Spirit" (1807), Hegel explores the nature of Christianity and its relationship to human consciousness. He argues that Christianity is a way of expressing the absolute, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

## The Berlin lectures

Hegel's Berlin lectures on Christianity (1821–1831) are a comprehensive work that explores the nature of Christianity and its relationship to human culture. In these lectures, he argues that Christianity is a way of expressing the absolute, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

## Issues of interpretation

Hegel's views on Christianity have been the subject of much debate and interpretation. Some scholars have argued that he was a Christian, while others have argued that he was an atheist.

# Philosophy of history

Hegel's philosophy of history is concerned with the nature of historical development and the role of human agency in shaping the world. He argues that history is a rational, systematic whole, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

# Dialectics, speculation, idealism

## Thesis–antithesis–synthesis

Hegel's concept of thesis-antithesis-synthesis is a central part of his philosophical system. He argues that reality is a rational, systematic whole, and that it can be understood through the use of dialectics.

# Reception

## "Right" vs. "Left" Hegelianism

Hegel's ideas have been the subject of much debate and interpretation. Some scholars have argued that he was a conservative, while others have argued that he was a radical.

## Reception in France

Hegel's ideas had a profound impact on French philosophy, particularly in the areas of existentialism and phenomenology.

## American pragmatism

Hegel's ideas also had an impact on American pragmatism, particularly in the work of William James and John Dewey.

# Publications and other writings

## Berlin lecture series

Hegel's Berlin lectures (1818–1831) are a comprehensive work that explores many areas of philosophy, including metaphysics, epistemology, and aesthetics.

# Notes

## Explanatory notes

This article is intended to provide a general overview of Hegel's life and philosophy. For more detailed information, please consult the references listed below.

This article does not include citations. For more information, please consult the references listed below.

## Secondary

article:
Reindeer
================================

The reindeer, also known as the caribou, is a species of deer that is native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of the world. Reindeer are known for their distinctive antlers, thick coats, and ability to survive in harsh, cold climates. They are an important part of the ecosystems in which they live, and play a vital role in the cultures and traditions of many indigenous communities.

Description
------------

Reindeer are members of the deer family (Cervidae) and are closely related to other deer species such as moose and elk. They are medium-sized animals, with adults typically weighing between 100 and 500 kg (220-1,100 lb). Reindeer have a distinctive body shape, with a compact torso, long legs, and a short tail. They have a thick coat of fur that helps to keep them warm in cold temperatures, and their fur can be brown, gray, or white in color.

Status
-------

Reindeer are listed as "vulnerable" on the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Red List. Their populations are declining in many parts of their range due to habitat loss, hunting, and climate change. In some areas, reindeer are considered an important food source and are hunted for their meat, while in other areas they are considered a nuisance and are hunted to control their populations.

Naming
-------

The term "reindeer" is often used to refer to the species as a whole, while the term "caribou" is used to refer specifically to the North American subspecies. The term "reindeer" comes from the Old Norse word "hreinn," which means " deer," while the term "caribou" comes from the Mi'kmaq word "kalibu," which means "shoveler" or " pawer."

Evolution
----------

Reindeer evolved from a common ancestor with other deer species during the Pleistocene era. The exact timing of their evolution is unclear, but it is thought that reindeer evolved in response to the changing climate of the Arctic region. Over time, reindeer developed a range of adaptations that allowed them to survive in the harsh, cold conditions of the Arctic, including their thick coats, antlers, and specialized digestive system.

Taxonomy
---------

### Naming and research on museum collections

The taxonomy of reindeer has been the subject of much debate and research. In the 19th century, many museums and collectors were interested in acquiring reindeer specimens for their collections. This led to a large number of reindeer being collected and studied, and many new subspecies were described.

### Biological exploration expeditions

In the early 20th century, a number of biological exploration expeditions were conducted to study the reindeer and their habitats. These expeditions helped to shed light on the ecology and behavior of reindeer, and led to a greater understanding of their taxonomy.

### Reclassification

In recent years, there has been a reclassification of reindeer subspecies based on genetic and molecular evidence. This has led to a greater understanding of the relationships between different reindeer populations, and has helped to clarify the taxonomy of the species.

#### Ecotypes

Reindeer can be divided into a number of ecotypes, each of which is adapted to a specific environment. These ecotypes include the arctic tundra ecotype, the boreal forest ecotype, and the mountain ecotype.

#### Genetic, molecular, and archaeological evidence

Recent studies have used genetic, molecular, and archaeological evidence to study the relationships between different reindeer populations. These studies have helped to shed light on the evolution and dispersal of reindeer, and have provided a greater understanding of their taxonomy.

#### Novel genetics-based clades

Recent genetic studies have identified a number of novel clades within the reindeer species. These clades are based on genetic differences between different reindeer populations, and have helped to clarify the taxonomy of the species.

Species and subspecies
----------------------

There are several subspecies of reindeer, including:

* Rangifer tarandus tarandus (the Arctic reindeer)
* Rangifer tarandus caribou (the North American caribou)
* Rangifer tarandus pearyi (the Peary caribou)
* Rangifer tarandus granti (the Grant's caribou)
* Rangifer tarandus groenlandicus (the Greenland caribou)

Physical characteristics
------------------------

### Antlers

Reindeer have distinctive antlers that are grown by both males and females. The antlers are made of bone and are grown each year, with the old antlers being shed in the spring. The antlers are used for fighting, defense, and attracting mates.

### Pelt

Reindeer have a thick coat of fur that helps to keep them warm in cold temperatures. The fur can be brown, gray, or white in color, and is often white on the belly and dark on the back.

### Heat exchange

Reindeer have a specialized heat exchange system that helps to conserve heat in cold temperatures. This system involves the circulation of warm blood through the legs and feet, which helps to warm the cold blood returning from the feet.

### Hooves

Reindeer have hooves that are adapted for walking on snow and ice. The hooves are made of keratin and are shaped like a crescent moon, which helps to provide traction on slippery surfaces.

### Size

Reindeer are medium-sized animals, with adults typically weighing between 100 and 500 kg (220-1,100 lb).

### Clicking sound

Reindeer make a distinctive clicking sound with their hooves, which is used for communication and mating.

### Eyes

Reindeer have large eyes that are adapted for seeing in low light conditions. The eyes are also very sensitive to movement, which helps to detect predators.

Biology and behaviors
----------------------

### Seasonal body composition

Reindeer have a seasonal body composition that changes depending on the availability of food. In the summer, reindeer eat as much as possible to build up fat reserves, which are then used to sustain them during the winter when food is scarce.

### Reproduction and life cycle

Reindeer breed in the fall, with the males engaging in a series of battles for dominance and mating rights. The females give birth to a single calf in the spring, which is then nursed for several months before being weaned.

### Social structure, migration and range

Reindeer are social animals that live in herds. The herds are typically made up of females and their young, while the males will often wander on their own or form bachelor groups. Reindeer migrate long distances each year, with some populations traveling over 3,000 miles (4,800 km) between their summer and winter ranges.

Ecology
--------

### Distribution and habitat

Reindeer are found in the Arctic and subarctic regions of the world, including Alaska, Canada, Russia, and Scandinavia. They inhabit a variety of habitats, including tundra, forests, and mountains.

### Diet

Reindeer are herbivores and eat a variety of plants, including grasses, leaves, and lichens. In the winter, they will also eat mosses and other non-vascular plants.

### Predators

Reindeer have a number of predators, including wolves, bears, and humans.

### Other threats

Reindeer are also threatened by habitat loss, climate change, and disease.

Conservation
------------

### Current status

Reindeer are listed as "vulnerable" on the IUCN Red List. Their populations are declining in many parts of their range due to habitat loss, hunting, and climate change.

### Boreal woodland caribou

The boreal woodland caribou is a subspecies of reindeer that is found in the boreal forests of Canada and Alaska. They are listed as "threatened" on the IUCN Red List and are protected by law in Canada.

### Peary caribou

The Peary caribou is a subspecies of reindeer that is found in the Arctic tundra of Canada and Alaska. They are listed as "endangered" on the IUCN Red List and are protected by law in Canada.

Relationship with humans
----------------------

### Indigenous North Americans

Reindeer have been an important part of the culture and traditions of many indigenous North American communities for thousands of years. They are hunted for their meat, hides, and antlers, and are also used for transportation and clothing.

### Indigenous Eurasians

Reindeer have also been an important part of the culture and traditions of many indigenous Eurasian communities for thousands of years. They are hunted for their meat, hides, and antlers, and are also used for transportation and clothing.

### Husbandry

Reindeer are also raised in captivity for their meat, hides, and antlers. They are typically raised on large farms or ranches, where they are fed a diet of hay and grains.

### History

Reindeer have been an important part of human history for thousands of years. They were first domesticated in Siberia around 2,000 years ago, and were later introduced to Europe and North America.

### Santa Claus

Reindeer are also famous for their association with Santa Claus, who is said to use them to pull his sleigh on Christmas Eve.

Lightyear (film)

Lightyear is a 2022 American computer-animated science fiction action-adventure film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures. The film is a spin-off of the Toy Story franchise and serves as an origin story for the character Buzz Lightyear, a toy space ranger in the original series.

# Plot

The film takes place in a galaxy where space rangers are tasked with exploring the cosmos and protecting the universe from threats. The story follows Buzz Lightyear, a young and ambitious space ranger who is part of Star Command, an organization dedicated to defending the galaxy. After being stranded on a hostile planet with his crew, Buzz embarks on a mission to find a way back home while confronting his own identity and the true nature of his existence.

As Buzz navigates through the unfamiliar terrain, he encounters a group of robots who are trying to take over the planet. With the help of a group of allies, including a skilled warrior named Izzy and a robot named Sox, Buzz must use his skills and ingenuity to defeat the robots and find a way off the planet.

Throughout his journey, Buzz grapples with the consequences of his actions and the weight of his responsibilities as a space ranger. The film explores themes of identity, purpose, and the complexities of heroism, offering a fresh and nuanced take on the beloved character.

# Voice cast

The film features an ensemble voice cast, including Chris Evans as the voice of Buzz Lightyear, Keke Palmer as Izzy Hawthorne, Peter Sohn as Sox, Taika Waititi as Mo Morrison, and Uzo Aduba as Alisha Hawthorne.

# Production

## Development

The idea for Lightyear originated from a conversation between Pixar Animation Studios' director Angus MacLane and producer Galyn Susman. MacLane, a longtime fan of science fiction, wanted to explore the character of Buzz Lightyear in a more dramatic and action-packed context. The film was initially conceived as a live-action project, but it eventually evolved into a computer-animated film.

## Casting

Chris Evans was the first actor to be cast in the film, with the role of Buzz Lightyear being written specifically for him. Evans, known for his portrayal of Captain America in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, brought a sense of gravitas and charisma to the character.

The rest of the cast was assembled over the course of several months, with Keke Palmer, Peter Sohn, Taika Waititi, and Uzo Aduba joining the project in various stages of production.

## Animation and design

The film's animation and design were handled by Pixar Animation Studios, with a team of artists and technicians working on the project over the course of several years. The film's visuals were inspired by a range of science fiction films and television shows, including Star Wars, Star Trek, and 2001: A Space Odyssey.

The film's characters and environments were designed to be highly detailed and realistic, with a focus on creating a sense of immersion and authenticity. The film's action sequences were choreographed to be fast-paced and intense, with a focus on showcasing Buzz's skills and abilities as a space ranger.

# Music

The film's score was composed by Michael Giacchino, who has worked on a range of films, including the Star Trek and Mission: Impossible franchises. The score was designed to be epic and sweeping, with a focus on capturing the sense of adventure and wonder that defines the film.

# Marketing

The film's marketing campaign was handled by Walt Disney Pictures, with a range of trailers, posters, and promotional materials being released in the months leading up to the film's release. The campaign focused on showcasing the film's action sequences, characters, and visuals, with a emphasis on highlighting the film's connections to the Toy Story franchise.

# Release

## Theatrical

The film was released in theaters on June 17, 2022, in the United States and Canada. The film was released in IMAX and 3D formats, with a range of special screenings and events being held in select theaters.

## Ban and censorship

The film was banned in several countries, including the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, and Egypt, due to the inclusion of a same-sex kiss between two characters. The ban was widely criticized by LGBTQ+ advocates and film critics, who argued that it was an example of censorship and intolerance.

## Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on August 3, 2022, and on Blu-ray and DVD on September 13, 2022. The home media release included a range of bonus features, including deleted scenes, behind-the-scenes footage, and a making-of documentary.

# Reception

## Streaming viewership

The film was released on Disney+ on August 3, 2022, and it quickly became one of the most-watched films on the platform. According to Nielsen Media Research, the film was streamed for over 1.3 billion minutes in its first week of release, making it one of the most-streamed films of the year.

## Box office

The film grossed over $225 million at the global box office, with a domestic total of over $118 million. The film's box office performance was seen as somewhat disappointing, given the film's production budget and marketing campaign.

## Critical response

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with an approval rating of 75% on Rotten Tomatoes. The film's visuals, action sequences, and performances were widely praised, with many critics noting that the film was a fun and entertaining addition to the Toy Story franchise.

However, some critics noted that the film's story was somewhat predictable and that the film's themes and characters were not as well-developed as they could have been.

## Accolades

The film was nominated for several awards, including a Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Visual Effects and a Satellite Award for Best Animated or Mixed Media Feature.

article:
God_of_War_Ragnarök

God of War Ragnarök is an action-adventure game developed by Santa Monica Studio and published by Sony Interactive Entertainment. It is the sequel to the 2018 game God of War and the ninth main installment in the God of War series. The game was released on November 9, 2022, for the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 consoles.

#Gameplay

God of War Ragnarök retains the same gameplay mechanics as its predecessor, with a focus on combat, exploration, and puzzle-solving. Players control Kratos, the game's protagonist, as he navigates through the Norse wilderness and battles various enemies, including gods, giants, and mythical creatures. The game features a variety of combat mechanics, including melee attacks, ranged attacks, and magical abilities.

The game also features a variety of exploration mechanics, including climbing, swimming, and traversing through the environment. Players can explore the game's world, which is set in a Norse mythology-inspired version of Scandinavia, and discover hidden secrets and side quests.

In addition to combat and exploration, the game also features a variety of puzzle-solving mechanics, including environmental puzzles and platforming challenges. Players must use Kratos's abilities and the environment to overcome obstacles and progress through the game.

#Synopsis

##Setting

God of War Ragnarök is set in a Norse mythology-inspired version of Scandinavia, specifically in the realms of Midgard, Alfheim, and Svartalfheim. The game takes place several years after the events of the previous game, and the world is on the brink of destruction due to the impending arrival of Ragnarök, a catastrophic event that will bring about the end of the world.

##Characters

The game features a variety of characters from Norse mythology, including gods, giants, and mythical creatures. The main character, Kratos, is joined by his son Atreus, who plays a significant role in the game's story.

Other notable characters include Thor, the god of thunder; Odin, the All-Father and king of the gods; Freya, the goddess of love and fertility; and Fenrir, the giant wolf. The game also features a variety of other characters, including dwarves, elves, and humans.

##Plot

The game's story follows Kratos and Atreus as they attempt to prevent Ragnarök from occurring. Along the way, they must navigate the complex web of Norse mythology and confront various gods and monsters.

The game's story is divided into several chapters, each of which takes place in a different realm. The game begins in Midgard, where Kratos and Atreus must confront the impending arrival of Ragnarök. They soon discover that the only way to prevent the catastrophe is to seek out the advice of the Norns, a group of powerful goddesses who possess knowledge of the future.

###Valhalla

One of the game's main chapters takes place in Valhalla, the afterlife for fallen warriors. Kratos and Atreus must navigate the treacherous world of Valhalla, where they encounter various gods and monsters.

In Valhalla, Kratos and Atreus must confront Thor, who is determined to prevent them from interfering with the events of Ragnarök. The chapter features a variety of epic battles, including a confrontation with Thor's hammer, Mjolnir.

#Development

The development of God of War Ragnarök began shortly after the release of the previous game. The game was developed by Santa Monica Studio, which is best known for its work on the God of War series.

##Casting

The game features a variety of voice actors, including Christopher Judge, who plays the role of Kratos. Judge's performance in the previous game was widely praised, and he returns to reprise his role in the sequel.

Other notable voice actors include Sunny Suljic, who plays the role of Atreus, and Danielle Bisutti, who plays the role of Freya.

##Pre-release fan backlash

Prior to the game's release, there was some backlash from fans who were concerned about the game's story and characters. Some fans were upset about the decision to include certain characters and plot twists, while others were concerned about the game's tone and direction.

However, the game's developers were quick to address these concerns, and the game's director, Eric Williams, stated that the team was committed to delivering a game that would meet the high standards set by the previous game.

##Soundtrack

The game's soundtrack was composed by Bear McCreary, who also composed the soundtrack for the previous game. The soundtrack features a variety of epic and atmospheric tracks, including a haunting main theme that sets the tone for the game.

#Release

God of War Ragnarök was released on November 9, 2022, for the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 consoles. The game was available in both physical and digital formats, and it was also available as part of a variety of special editions and bundles.

#Reception

God of War Ragnarök received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. Reviewers praised the game's story, characters, and gameplay, and many considered it to be one of the best games of the year.

##Sales

The game was a commercial success, and it sold millions of copies worldwide. The game's success was driven in part by the popularity of the previous game, as well as the strong marketing campaign and positive word of mouth.

##Awards

God of War Ragnarök won numerous awards, including several Game of the Year awards. The game also won awards for its story, characters, and gameplay, and it was widely recognized as one of the best games of the year.

#Future

The success of God of War Ragnarök has ensured that the God of War series will continue for many years to come. The game's developers have already begun working on a new game in the series, and there are rumors of a potential sequel to Ragnarök.

However, the game's director, Eric Williams, has stated that the team is committed to taking the time to develop a game that meets the high standards set by Ragnarök. As a result, it may be several years before the next game in the series is released.

#Notes

God of War Ragnarök is the first game in the God of War series to feature a Norse mythology-inspired setting. The game's story and characters are based on the myths and legends of Norse mythology, and the game features a variety of characters and locations from the mythology.

The game's director, Eric Williams, has stated that the team drew inspiration from a variety of sources when developing the game, including Norse mythology, comic books, and heavy metal music.

Big Brother 25 (American season)

Big Brother 25 is the 25th season of the American reality television series Big Brother. The season premiered on July 6, 2023, and concluded on September 25, 2023. The season featured 16 new Houseguests competing for a grand prize of $750,000.

Format
--------

The format of Big Brother 25 remained largely unchanged from previous seasons, with a few notable changes and additions.

Format changes and additions
---------------------------

### BB Break-in and BB Multiverse

This season introduced two new twists: BB Break-in and BB Multiverse. BB Break-in allowed a new Houseguest to enter the house and compete in a competition to earn a spot in the game. BB Multiverse, on the other hand, introduced a series of alternate universes, each with its own unique twist and gameplay.

### BB Multiverse

BB Multiverse consisted of four different universes, each with its own distinct theme and gameplay.

#### Comic-verse

The Comic-verse universe featured a more light-hearted and comedic tone, with challenges and competitions inspired by comic books and superheroes.

#### Humili-verse

The Humili-verse universe focused on humiliation and embarrassment, with challenges designed to test the Houseguests' ability to withstand embarrassment and ridicule.

#### Scary-verse

The Scary-verse universe introduced a horror-themed twist, with challenges and competitions inspired by scary movies and haunted houses.

#### Scramble-verse

Russian Invasion of Ukraine

The Russian invasion of Ukraine began on February 24, 2022, when Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a "special military operation" in Ukraine. The invasion marked a significant escalation of the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, which had been simmering since 2014. The invasion has resulted in thousands of deaths, widespread destruction, and a massive humanitarian crisis.

# Background

## Post-Soviet relations

Following the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, Ukraine and Russia established diplomatic relations. However, the relationship between the two countries was complicated by issues such as energy dependence, border disputes, and conflicting views on NATO expansion. In 2004, the Orange Revolution brought pro-Western President Viktor Yushchenko to power, which led to a deterioration in relations with Russia.

## Ukrainian revolution, Russian intervention in Crimea and Donbas

In 2013, Ukraine's then-President Viktor Yanukovych suspended plans to sign an association agreement with the European Union, sparking protests in Kiev. The protests eventually led to Yanukovych's ouster in February 2014. Russia responded by annexing Crimea in March 2014 and supporting separatist rebels in eastern Ukraine, particularly in the Donbas region. The conflict in Donbas resulted in over 14,000 deaths and the displacement of millions of people.

# Prelude

## Putin's invasion announcement

On February 24, 2022, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a "special military operation" in Ukraine, citing the need to protect ethnic Russians and Russian-speaking populations in Ukraine. Putin also claimed that Ukraine was planning to join NATO, which he saw as a threat to Russia's national security.

# Events

The battle of Bakhmut was a prolonged and intense battle between Ukrainian and Russian forces. The battle was marked by heavy casualties on both sides.

Tornado Outbreak of December 12–15, 2022

The Tornado Outbreak of December 12–15, 2022, was a significant and destructive tornado outbreak that affected the Southern United States. The outbreak occurred over a four-day period, producing numerous tornadoes across multiple states. The event was characterized by a complex and dynamic weather pattern, which led to the development of a prolonged and intense period of severe weather.

#Meteorological synopsis

The outbreak was fueled by a strong and complex weather system that developed over the southern Plains on December 11, 2022. A potent low-pressure system formed over eastern New Mexico, which began to move eastward and intensify. As the system interacted with a strong cold front, a dry line, and a warm front, it created a highly unstable atmosphere that was conducive to severe thunderstorm development.

On December 12, a strong upper-level disturbance moved into the region, providing additional lift and instability. This led to the development of a large-scale severe weather outbreak, characterized by numerous supercells and a significant tornado threat. The outbreak continued through December 13, with the worst of the severe weather occurring during the late afternoon and evening hours.

On December 14, the low-pressure system and its associated fronts began to move eastward, bringing the severe weather threat into the Southeastern United States. The outbreak continued through December 15, with the last of the severe weather occurring in the late morning hours.

#Confirmed tornadoes

A total of 124 tornadoes were confirmed during the outbreak, with the majority occurring on December 12 and 13. The tornadoes were distributed across multiple states, including Texas, Oklahoma, Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and Georgia.

##December 12 event

On December 12, a total of 55 tornadoes were confirmed, with the majority occurring in Texas and Oklahoma. The most significant tornado of the day was a long-lived EF3 tornado that touched down in northwestern Texas, causing significant damage and injuring several people.

##December 13 event

On December 13, a total of 43 tornadoes were confirmed, with the majority occurring in Arkansas and Louisiana. The most significant tornado of the day was a devastating EF4 tornado that touched down in central Arkansas, causing widespread destruction and killing several people.

##December 14 event

On December 14, a total of 20 tornadoes were confirmed, with the majority occurring in Mississippi and Alabama. The most significant tornado of the day was a long-lived EF2 tornado that touched down in eastern Mississippi, causing significant damage and injuring several people.

##December 15 event

On December 15, a total of 6 tornadoes were confirmed, with the majority occurring in Georgia. The most significant tornado of the day was a weak EF1 tornado that touched down in northwestern Georgia, causing minor damage.

##Farmerville, Louisiana

On December 13, a devastating tornado outbreak occurred in Farmerville, Louisiana, resulting in significant damage and loss of life. A total of 5 tornadoes were confirmed in the area, with the most significant being an EF4 tornado that touched down in the city. The tornado caused widespread destruction, including the complete destruction of a large apartment complex. Several people were killed, and many more were injured.

#Non-tornadic effects

In addition to the tornadoes, the outbreak produced significant non-tornadic effects, including damaging winds, large hail, and heavy rainfall. The strongest winds were reported in Texas, where gusts reached up to 80 mph. The largest hail was reported in Oklahoma, where hailstones reached up to 2 inches in diameter. Heavy rainfall was reported across multiple states, with totals reaching up to 6 inches in some areas.

#Impact

The outbreak had a significant impact on the affected areas, with widespread damage and disruption. The tornadoes caused significant destruction to homes, businesses, and infrastructure, with many areas left without power or access to basic services. The outbreak also had a significant economic impact, with estimated damages in the billions of dollars.

article:
Saul Gone

Saul Gone is a 2022 American drama film that serves as a continuation of the Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul series. The movie follows the story of Saul Goodman, a small-time lawyer who becomes embroiled in a complex web of crime and deception. The film explores themes of identity, morality, and the consequences of one's actions.

#Plot

The movie takes place after the events of Better Call Saul and follows Saul Goodman, played by Bob Odenkirk, as he navigates a new reality. The story begins with Saul living in hiding, using the alias "Gene Takavic" and working as a manager at a Cinnabon store in Omaha, Nebraska. However, his life is disrupted when he is recognized by a group of locals who threaten to expose his true identity.

As Saul tries to maintain his cover, he becomes embroiled in a series of misadventures, including a botched heist and a run-in with a pair of ruthless thugs. Along the way, he encounters a number of familiar characters from the Breaking Bad universe, including Kim Wexler, played by Rhea Seehorn, and Ed Galbraith, played by Robert Forster.

Throughout the film, Saul is forced to confront the consequences of his past actions and the moral compromises he has made. As he navigates this complex web of relationships and alliances, he must also contend with his own sense of identity and the persona he has created for himself.

#Production

##Development

The idea for Saul Gone originated with Vince Gilligan, the creator of Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul. Gilligan had always envisioned a feature film continuation of the series and saw an opportunity to explore the character of Saul Goodman in greater depth.

In an interview, Gilligan explained that he wanted to create a film that would be both a satisfying conclusion to the series and a standalone story that could be enjoyed by new viewers. He worked closely with writer and director Peter Gould to develop the script and bring the story to life.

##Casting

The cast of Saul Gone includes a number of familiar faces from the Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul universe. Bob Odenkirk reprises his role as Saul Goodman, while Rhea Seehorn returns as Kim Wexler. The film also features a number of guest stars, including Jonathan Banks, Giancarlo Esposito, and Mark Margolis.

In addition to the returning cast members, the film introduces a number of new characters, including a pair of ruthless thugs played by Ray Campbell and Scott MacArthur. The cast delivers strong performances throughout the film, bringing depth and nuance to the characters.

##Writing

The script for Saul Gone was written by Peter Gould, who also directed the film. Gould worked closely with Vince Gilligan to develop the story and ensure that it stayed true to the spirit of the original series.

The script is a complex and nuanced exploration of the human condition, delving into themes of identity, morality, and the consequences of one's actions. The dialogue is witty and engaging, with a number of memorable moments and exchanges between the characters.

##Filming

Principal photography for Saul Gone took place in Albuquerque, New Mexico, and Omaha, Nebraska. The film was shot on location, with a number of scenes filmed at actual locations in the city.

The cinematography is handled by Marshall Adams, who brings a distinctive visual style to the film. The camerawork is inventive and expressive, using a range of techniques to capture the mood and atmosphere of each scene.

#Themes and motifs

Saul Gone explores a number of themes and motifs, including identity, morality, and the consequences of one's actions. The film is a complex and nuanced exploration of the human condition, delving into the complexities and contradictions of human nature.

One of the central themes of the film is the idea of identity and how it is constructed. Saul Goodman is a character who has created a persona for himself, using a combination of charm, wit, and deception to navigate the world. However, as the film progresses, it becomes clear that this persona is a fragile construct, one that is threatened by the consequences of his past actions.

The film also explores the theme of morality, raising questions about the nature of right and wrong. Saul is a character who has made a number of moral compromises, using his skills and charm to further his own interests. However, as he navigates the complex web of relationships and alliances, he is forced to confront the consequences of his actions and the harm that he has caused.

#Reception

##Critical response

Saul Gone received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising its complex characters, nuanced themes, and engaging storyline.

In a review for The New York Times, critic A.O. Scott praised the film's "wit, charm, and intellectual curiosity," noting that it is a " satisfying conclusion to the series." Similarly, critic Emily Nussbaum of The New Yorker praised the film's " complex characters and nuanced themes," noting that it is a " standout achievement in the world of television."

##Ratings

Saul Gone was a ratings success, drawing a large audience upon its release. The film was watched by over 5 million viewers in its initial broadcast, making it one of the most-watched films of the year.

#Notes

Saul Gone is a feature film continuation of the Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul series. The film was written and directed by Peter Gould and stars Bob Odenkirk as Saul Goodman.

The film explores a number of themes and motifs, including identity, morality, and the consequences of one's actions. It is a complex and nuanced exploration of the human condition, delving into the complexities and contradictions of human nature.

Mariupol
==========

Mariupol is a city located in the Donetsk Oblast of Ukraine, situated on the north coast of the Sea of Azov. With a population of approximately 432,000 people, Mariupol is one of the largest cities in Ukraine and a significant industrial and cultural center. The city has a rich history, diverse economy, and a unique cultural identity shaped by its strategic location and varied influences.

History
--------

### Ancient History

The area around Mariupol has been inhabited since ancient times, with archaeological findings indicating the presence of human settlements dating back to the Bronze Age. The city's location on the Sea of Azov made it an attractive place for trade and commerce, with the ancient Greeks establishing a settlement in the area in the 5th century BCE.

### Crimean Khanate

In the 13th century, the Golden Horde conquered the region, and Mariupol became part of the Crimean Khanate. During this period, the city was an important center for trade and commerce, with merchants from all over the world visiting the city's markets.

### Cossack Period

In the 16th century, Mariupol became part of the Zaporozhian Cossacks' territory, a semi-autonomous state of Ukrainian Cossacks. The Cossacks played a significant role in shaping the city's culture and identity, with many of their traditions and customs still celebrated today.

### Russian Empire and Soviet Union

In 1779, Mariupol was annexed by the Russian Empire, and the city underwent significant modernization and industrialization. During the Soviet era, Mariupol became a major industrial center, with the city's steel plant, Azovstal, being one of the largest in the Soviet Union.

### World War II

During World War II, Mariupol was occupied by German forces, and the city suffered significant damage and loss of life. The city was liberated by Soviet forces in 1943, and it played a significant role in the country's post-war reconstruction.

### Russo-Ukrainian War

#### War in Donbas and Economic Downturn

In 2014, Mariupol became a key location in the War in Donbas, with Ukrainian government forces clashing with Russian-backed separatists in the area. The conflict led to significant economic downturn and humanitarian crisis in the city, with many residents forced to flee or live in difficult conditions.

#### 2022 Russian Siege and Subsequent Occupation

In February 2022, Russian forces launched a large-scale invasion of Ukraine, and Mariupol became one of the key targets. The city was subjected to a prolonged siege, with Russian forces bombarding the city with artillery and aerial attacks. The city's infrastructure, including its hospitals, schools, and residential areas, was severely damaged, and many civilians were killed or injured. In May 2022, Russian forces took control of the city, and it has since been under occupation.

Geography
---------

### Climate

Mariupol has a humid continental climate, with warm summers and cold winters. The city's location on the Sea of Azov moderates its climate, with the sea having a cooling effect in the summer and a warming effect in the winter.

### Ecology

The area around Mariupol is characterized by a mix of steppe and forest ecosystems, with the city's location on the coast of the Sea of Azov supporting a diverse range of flora and fauna. However, the city's industrial activities have had a significant impact on its environment, with pollution and habitat destruction being major concerns.

Governance
------------

### City Administration and Local Politics

Mariupol is governed by a city council, which is composed of elected representatives from the city's different districts. The city is also home to a number of local government agencies, including the city administration, police department, and emergency services.

### Administrative Division

Mariupol is divided into four districts: Central, Kalmiuskyi, Livoberezhnyi, and Prymorskyi. Each district has its own local government and administration.

### Coat of Arms

The coat of arms of Mariupol features a shield with a gold anchor on a blue background, symbolizing the city's maritime history and its connection to the Sea of Azov.

### City Holidays

Mariupol celebrates a number of city holidays throughout the year, including City Day, which is celebrated on September 10th.

Demographics
------------

### Ethnic Structure

According to the 2001 census, the ethnic structure of Mariupol is as follows: Ukrainians (48.7%), Russians (44.4%), Greeks (4.3%), Belarusians (1.1%), and others (1.5%).

### Language Structure

The language structure of Mariupol is as follows: Russian (89.4%), Ukrainian (9.1%), and others (1.5%).

### Religious Communities

Mariupol is home to a number of religious communities, including Orthodox Christians, Catholics, Protestants, and Muslims.

Economy
--------

### Employment

The main industries in Mariupol are metallurgy, machinery, and food processing. The city is home to a number of major employers, including the Azovstal steel plant and the Mariupol Sea Port.

### Industry

Mariupol is a major industrial center, with a number of key industries, including metallurgy, machinery, and food processing. The city is home to a number of major industrial facilities, including the Azovstal steel plant and the Mariupol Sea Port.

### Finances

Mariupol has a significant budget, with the majority of its revenue coming from taxes, fees, and state subsidies. The city also receives funding from international organizations and donors.

Culture

2023 Canada Open

The 2023 Canada Open, also known as the National Bank Open presented by Rogers for sponsorship reasons, was a professional tennis tournament scheduled to take place in Montreal and Toronto, Canada, from August 7 to August 13, 2023. The tournament was part of the ATP Tour 2023 and the WTA Tour 2023.

# Tournament

## Venue

The men's tournament was held at the IGA Stadium in Montreal, Quebec, while the women's tournament was held at the Sobeys Stadium in Toronto, Ontario. Both venues have a seating capacity of over 11,000 spectators.

## Point distribution

The tournament was an ATP Masters 1000 event and a WTA 1000 event, offering a total of 1,000 points to the winners of the singles titles.

## Prize pool

The total prize pool for the tournament was $6,573,785, with the men's singles champion receiving $1,019,335 and the women's singles champion receiving $954,720.

# Men's singles

## Seeds

The top eight seeds in the men's singles draw were:

1.  Novak Djokovic (Serbia)
2.  Carlos Alcaraz (Spain)
3.  Daniil Medvedev (Russia)
4.  Stefanos Tsitsipas (Greece)
5.  Casper Ruud (Norway)
6.  Andrey Rublev (Russia)
7.  Holger Rune (Denmark)
8.  Jannik Sinner (Italy)

## Finals

The men's singles final was played between Novak Djokovic and Daniil Medvedev, with Djokovic winning in three sets, 6-3, 6-7(4-7), 6-4.

## Top half

### Section 1

In the first section of the top half, Novak Djokovic defeated Alex de Minaur in the second round, 6-2, 6-1. He then defeated Cameron Norrie in the third round, 6-3, 6-4. In the quarterfinals, Djokovic defeated Andrey Rublev, 6-4, 6-4.

In the second section of the top half, Carlos Alcaraz defeated Tommy Paul in the second round, 6-4, 6-4. He then defeated Sebastian Korda in the third round, 6-2, 6-4. However, Alcaraz lost to Daniil Medvedev in the quarterfinals, 6-3, 6-7(4-7), 6-3.

## Bottom half

### Section 3

In the third section of the bottom half, Stefanos Tsitsipas defeated Grigor Dimitrov in the second round, 6-4, 6-4. He then defeated Nick Kyrgios in the third round, 6-3, 6-4. However, Tsitsipas lost to Holger Rune in the quarterfinals, 6-4, 6-7(4-7), 6-2.

### Section 4

In the fourth section of the bottom half, Casper Ruud defeated Emil Ruusuvuori in the second round, 6-4, 6-2. He then defeated Jannik Sinner in the third round, 6-4, 6-7(4-7), 6-2. However, Ruud lost to Daniil Medvedev in the semifinals, 6-2, 6-4.

# Women's singles

article:
Samrat Prithviraj

Samrat Prithviraj is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language historical action drama film directed by Chandraprakash Dwivedi and produced by Yash Raj Films. The film is based on the life of Prithviraj Chauhan, a king of the Chauhan dynasty who ruled parts of northern India in the 12th century. The film stars Akshay Kumar in the title role, with Manushi Chhillar, Sanjay Dutt, and Sonu Sood in supporting roles.

# Plot

The film tells the story of Prithviraj Chauhan, a brave and powerful king who ruled Ajmer and Delhi in the 12th century. The story begins with Prithviraj's childhood, where he is shown to be a skilled warrior and a just ruler. As he grows up, he faces numerous challenges from neighboring kingdoms and invaders, including the Ghaznavid Empire. The film follows Prithviraj's journey as he battles against these enemies and ultimately faces off against Muhammad Ghori, the ruler of the Ghaznavid Empire.

The film also explores Prithviraj's romance with Sanyukta, the daughter of the ruler of Kanauj, and his friendship with Chand Bardai, a poet and musician who becomes his confidant. The film's climax features a dramatic battle between Prithviraj and Muhammad Ghori, which ultimately leads to Prithviraj's defeat and capture.

# Cast

* Akshay Kumar as Prithviraj Chauhan
* Manushi Chhillar as Sanyukta
* Sanjay Dutt as Kaka Kanha
* Sonu Sood as Chand Bardai
* Manav Vij as Muhammad Ghori
* Ashutosh Rana as Jayachandra
* Sakshi Tanwar as Jayachandra's wife
* Lalit Tiwari as Anangpal Tomar

# Production

## Development

The film was first announced in 2019, with Chandraprakash Dwivedi set to direct and Akshay Kumar starring in the title role. The film's script was written by Dwivedi, who had previously directed the film Pinjar and the TV series Chanakya. The film's production was handled by Yash Raj Films, with Aditya Chopra serving as the producer.

## Casting

Akshay Kumar was the first actor to be cast in the film, with the role of Prithviraj Chauhan being written specifically for him. Manushi Chhillar was cast as Sanyukta, Prithviraj's love interest, after a rigorous auditioning process. Sanjay Dutt and Sonu Sood were cast in supporting roles, with Dutt playing the role of Kaka Kanha, a close friend and advisor to Prithviraj.

## Filming

The film's principal photography began in November 2020, with filming taking place in various locations across India, including Jaipur, Jodhpur, and Delhi. The film's action sequences were choreographed by Franz Spilhaus, who had previously worked on films such as Tiger Zinda Hai and War.

# Release

## Certification

The film received a U/A certificate from the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC), with the board suggesting several cuts and modifications to the film's content.

## Litigations

The film was involved in a controversy surrounding the use of the title "Samrat Prithviraj", with a petition being filed in the Delhi High Court claiming that the title was misleading and could cause confusion among audiences. The court ultimately dismissed the petition, allowing the film to retain its title.

## Theatrical release

The film was released theatrically on June 3, 2022, in over 3,000 screens across India. The film received a wide release, with several multiplex chains and single-screen theaters screening the film.

## Home media

The film's digital rights were acquired by Amazon Prime Video, with the film being made available on the platform several weeks after its theatrical release.

# Reception

## Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with several praising Akshay Kumar's performance and the film's action sequences, while others criticising the film's storytelling and historical inaccuracies. The film holds a rating of 50% on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 20 reviews, with an average rating of 5.5/10.

## Box office

The film performed moderately at the box office, grossing over ₹50 crore in its opening weekend. The film's total worldwide gross was over ₹150 crore, making it a moderate commercial success.

# Soundtrack

The film's soundtrack was composed by Shankar-Ehsaan-Loy, with lyrics written by Varun Grover. The soundtrack features several songs, including "Yoddha", "Har Har Shankar", and "Raj-Yudh".

# Notes

* The film's budget was estimated to be around ₹150-200 crore, making it one of the most expensive films produced by Yash Raj Films.
* The film's action sequences were choreographed by Franz Spilhaus, who had previously worked on films such as Tiger Zinda Hai and War.
* The film's cinematography was handled by Manush Nandan, who had previously worked on films such as Kaabil and Rangoon.

# References

# External links

article:
Joe Biden Classified Documents Incident

The Joe Biden classified documents incident refers to the discovery of classified documents in the possession of Joe Biden, the 46th President of the United States, from his time as Vice President under Barack Obama. The incident began in November 2022, when Biden's lawyers discovered a batch of classified documents at the Penn Biden Center for Diplomacy and Global Engagement, a think tank affiliated with the University of Pennsylvania. Since then, additional classified documents have been found at Biden's Wilmington, Delaware home and other locations.

#Background

Joe Biden served as Vice President of the United States from 2009 to 2017, under President Barack Obama. During his time in office, Biden had access to sensitive and classified information. After leaving office, Biden established the Penn Biden Center for Diplomacy and Global Engagement, a think tank affiliated with the University of Pennsylvania, where he maintained an office.

#Discoveries and other developments

##First batch of documents

In November 2022, Biden's lawyers discovered a batch of classified documents at the Penn Biden Center for Diplomacy and Global Engagement. The documents were reportedly found in a locked closet in Biden's office. The discovery was made by Biden's lawyers, who were conducting a review of the documents stored at the center. The lawyers immediately notified the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) and the Department of Justice (DOJ) about the discovery.

##DOJ letter to Bob Bauer

In December 2022, the DOJ sent a letter to Bob Bauer, Biden's personal lawyer, requesting that the White House take steps to protect the classified documents until they could be properly reviewed and returned to the National Archives. The letter was written by the DOJ's National Security Division and was signed by the division's chief, Matthew Olsen.

##Second batch of documents

On January 12, 2023, Biden's lawyers announced that they had discovered a second batch of classified documents at Biden's Wilmington, Delaware home. The documents were found in a storage room in the garage of Biden's home. The discovery was made during a search of the property, which was conducted by Biden's lawyers in response to the initial discovery of classified documents at the Penn Biden Center.

##FBI search of Biden's Wilmington home

On January 21, 2023, the FBI conducted a search of Biden's Wilmington, Delaware home, as part of the ongoing investigation into the classified documents. The search was conducted by a team of FBI agents, who were accompanied by Biden's lawyers. The search lasted for several hours and resulted in the discovery of additional classified documents.

##Other searches

In addition to the search of Biden's Wilmington home, the FBI also conducted searches of other locations, including the Penn Biden Center and Biden's Rehoboth Beach, Delaware home. The searches were part of the ongoing investigation into the classified documents and were conducted by teams of FBI agents.

#Initial responses

##Biden and his legal team

Biden and his legal team have maintained that the discovery of the classified documents was an honest mistake and that they have cooperated fully with the investigation. In a statement, Biden said that he was "surprised" by the discovery of the documents and that he had not been aware of their existence.

##Elected officials

###Republican elected officials

Republican elected officials have criticized Biden's handling of the classified documents, with some calling for his impeachment. Senator Ted Cruz of Texas said that Biden's actions were "inexcusable" and that he had "compromised national security."

###Democratic elected officials

Democratic elected officials have defended Biden's handling of the classified documents, with some saying that the incident was a "mistake" and that Biden had cooperated fully with the investigation. Senator Dick Durbin of Illinois said that Biden had "done the right thing" by notifying the National Archives and the DOJ about the discovery of the documents.

##Media analysis

Media analysts have offered mixed opinions on the incident, with some saying that it was a serious breach of national security and others saying that it was a minor mistake. Some analysts have noted that the incident has raised questions about Biden's handling of classified information and his ability to protect national security.

##Misinformation

The incident has also been the subject of misinformation, with some social media users spreading false claims about the discovery of the documents and Biden's handling of the incident. Fact-checkers have debunked several of these claims, including a false claim that Biden had intentionally hidden the documents.

##Discovery of classified documents at Mike Pence's residence

In February 2023, it was reported that classified documents had been discovered at the residence of former Vice President Mike Pence. The discovery was made by Pence's lawyers, who were conducting a review of the documents stored at his home. The incident has raised questions about the handling of classified information by former government officials and the need for greater transparency and accountability.

#Investigations

##Special counsel

In January 2023, Attorney General Merrick Garland appointed a special counsel to investigate the discovery of the classified documents. The special counsel, Robert Hur, is a former federal prosecutor who has experience handling national security cases.

###Decision that charges were unwarranted

In March 2023, the special counsel announced that no charges would be brought against Biden in connection with the discovery of the classified documents. The decision was made after a thorough investigation, which included interviews with Biden and his staff.

###Comments on Biden's memory

The special counsel also made comments about Biden's memory, saying that Biden had been "forthcoming" about his handling of the classified documents and that he had not intentionally tried to conceal them. The comments were seen as a rebuke to critics who had questioned Biden's memory and his ability to serve as President.

##Congressional

In addition to the special counsel's investigation, Congress has also launched its own investigation into the discovery of the classified documents. The investigation is being led by the House Oversight Committee, which has subpoenaed documents and witnesses in connection with the incident.

* Special counsel

### Post-production

The film's visual effects team, led by John Moffatt, worked on creating the film's CGI sequences, including the Megalodon.

article:
2022 Wimbledon Championships – Women's singles

The 2022 Wimbledon Championships – Women's singles was the main women's event of the 135th edition of Wimbledon. It was held at the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in London, United Kingdom.

#Seeds

The seeds for the women's singles event were announced on 23 June 2022. The seeding was based on the WTA rankings as of 20 June 2022. The top 32 players in the world were seeded, with the exception of players from Russia and Belarus, who were banned from participating in the tournament due to the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine.

#Draw

The women's singles draw consisted of 128 players, with the top 32 seeds receiving a bye into the second round. The draw was conducted on 24 June 2022.

##Key

* Q = Qualifier
* WC = Wild card
* LL = Lucky loser
* PR = Protected ranking
* w/o = Walkover
* r = Retired
* d = Defaulted

##Finals

Elena Rybakina won her first Grand Slam title, defeating Ons Jabeur in the final, 3-6, 6-2, 6-2.

##Top half

###Section 1

The top quarter of the draw featured top seed Iga Świątek, who was seeking to win her second Grand Slam title of the year. However, she was upset by Alizé Cornet in the third round, 6-4, 4-6, 6-2.

###Section 2

The second quarter of the draw featured fourth seed Paula Badosa, who was seeking to reach her first Grand Slam quarterfinal. However, she was upset by Petra Martić in the fourth round, 6-4, 7-5.

###Section 3

The third quarter of the draw featured eighth seed Jessica Pegula, who was seeking to reach her first Grand Slam quarterfinal. However, she was upset by Badosa's conqueror, Petra Martić, in the quarterfinals, 6-2, 6-3.

###Section 4

The fourth quarter of the draw featured fifth seed Maria Sakkari, who was seeking to reach her first Grand Slam semifinal. However, she was upset by Tatjana Maria in the third round, 6-3, 7-5.

##Bottom half

###Section 5

The fifth quarter of the draw featured third seed Ons Jabeur, who was seeking to reach her first Grand Slam final. She defeated 24th seed Elise Mertens in the quarterfinals, 6-2, 3-6, 6-1.

###Section 6

article:
Warner Bros. Discovery
=====================

Warner Bros. Discovery is a multinational mass media and entertainment conglomerate formed through the merger of WarnerMedia and Discovery, Inc. in 2021. The company is one of the largest media conglomerates in the world, with a diverse range of assets in film, television, cable networks, and digital media.

Background
----------

### 1923–1979

The history of Warner Bros. Discovery dates back to 1923, when Warner Bros. was founded by four brothers: Harry, Albert, Samuel, and Jack Warner. The company started as a film production and distribution company, releasing its first feature film, "My Four Years in Germany," in 1918. Over the years, Warner Bros. grew to become one of the major film studios in Hollywood, producing classics such as "Casablanca" and "The Wizard of Oz."

In the 1950s and 1960s, Warner Bros. expanded into television, producing popular shows such as "The Jack Benny Program" and "Maverick." The company also ventured into music, establishing Warner Bros. Records in 1958.

### 1979–1994

In 1979, Warner Communications was formed, bringing together Warner Bros. and other media assets, including Atari, Inc. and Warner-Amex Satellite Entertainment. The company went public in 1972, raising capital to expand its operations.

In the 1980s, Warner Communications acquired several cable television networks, including MTV Networks and HBO. The company also expanded its film and television production operations, producing hits such as "Batman" and "Friends."

### 1996–2019

In 1996, Warner Communications merged with Time Inc. to form Time Warner, one of the largest media conglomerates in the world. The company continued to expand its operations, acquiring Turner Broadcasting System in 1996 and AOL in 2001.

In 2018, AT&T acquired Time Warner, renaming it WarnerMedia. The company continued to produce and distribute content across its various platforms, including HBO, Warner Bros., and Turner.

History
-------

### Formation and beginning of operations (2021–2022)

In May 2021, AT&T announced that it would spin off WarnerMedia and merge it with Discovery, Inc. The merger was completed on April 8, 2022, forming Warner Bros. Discovery.

The new company is led by David Zaslav, the former CEO of Discovery, Inc. Warner Bros. Discovery is headquartered in New York City and has operations around the world.

The company's portfolio includes a diverse range of assets, including:

* Warner Bros. film and television studios
* HBO and HBO Max
* Turner Broadcasting System, including TBS, TNT, and TruTV
* Discovery Channel, Animal Planet, and Science Channel
* CNN and HLN
* Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment
* DC Comics

### Turnover and cutbacks (2023–present)

In 2023, Warner Bros. Discovery began to implement significant changes to its operations, including the departure of several high-profile executives and the elimination of hundreds of jobs.

The company also announced plans to restructure its film and television production operations, including the consolidation of its film studios and the elimination of several production deals.

Leadership
